text.tspan: A qube is where you do your work, store your files, or generally use your computer.
Qubes OS lets you compartmentalize your digital life into securely isolated "qubes."
Each qube is technically a VM (virtual machine) and is based on a Linux template
such as Debian or Fedora and makes efficient use of your computer's resources
You can even connect other qubes such as a Networking Qube so that all of
your internet traffic gets routed through Tor or a VPN (virtual private network)
Once a template is chosen one then assigns properties to a qube like determining
which apps are run inside of it such as Firefox and the Tor Browser
It's useful to separate types of activity into different qubes such as personal
web browsing, anonymous web browsing, and/or online banking
Qubes OS, comes with multiple recipes which are preconfigured "qubes" that make
it super simple for any type of user to get up and running with Qubes
